summary.p:
A multi-text (possibly composite) manuscript, entitled Vayittiyam mūṉṟu ("Three [texts] on medicine") on its additional title page, containing several works on traditional medicine, i.e.:
The Irāmatēvar aruḷiceyta vayittiyam eṇpattoṇṇu ("Eighty-one [verses] on the medicine graciously composed by Irāmatēvar"), which appears to be a medical text. As indicated by the title, its author is Irāmatēvar, i.e. one of the prominent authors of Tamil Siddha medico-alchemical literature. The work consists of 81 enumerated verses (U2).
One leaf with prefatory part of a medical text (U3).
A text entitled on the margin as Vayittiya cāstiram ariyum paṭi vuṇarttiyatu, which in fact may be a cluster of several various texts, as indiated by the inconsistent numbering of the verses (U4).
An untitled text with medical recipes (U5).

According to the (inadequate) title page, the manuscript contains 3 works:
The Irāmatēvar ~ 50.
The Tēraiyār vayittiyam ("Medicine of Tēraiyār").
A Vayttiyacillaṟai ("Fragments on medicine").

supportDesc.foliation: Tamil folation in left margin. Arabic library foliation (lf) in pencil on right margin.

collation.desc: 30 folios = Irāmatēvar aruḷiceyta vayittiyam eṇpattoṇṇu. Tamil foliation 1-30 = Library Arabic foliation 1-30.
1 folio = TBC. No Tamil foliation = Library Arabic foliation 30bis in pencil on right margin. Possibly introduction to the text.

24 folios = Vayittiya cāstiram ariyum paṭi vuṇarttiyatu. Text in 46 verses. Tamil foliation 1-24 on the left margin = Library Arabic foliation 31-54 in pencil on the right margin. This text may acually be a cluster of 3 texts, as the contained verses are enumerated as follows: 2-40 (f31r-41r/1r-11r), 1-10(f41r-43v/11r-13v), 3-46 (f44r-54r/13r-24r).
12 folios = TBC. Tamil foliation 79-91 on the left margin (with no black pigment) = Library Arabic foliation 55-67 in pencil on the right margin.
1 folio = back guard leaf. No Tamil foliation = Library Arabic foliation 68. Blank recto verso.

supportDesc.condition: Good state of preservation, in spite of a few broken corners and boreholes caused by insects.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Dated to circa 1820 by Vinson (1868) on unstated grounds, not dated by Cabaton (1912). Not after 1854, since part of the collection of Édouard Ariel (1818-1854), bequeathed in 1855 to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1868).

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequeathed by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. — See BnF, Département des Manuscrits, Inventaire 7 = dons : manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, n° 1 à 3306: no. 1192.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 23, n0. 122..
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 33r, no. 122.

Vinson, Julien. 1868. Manuscrits tamouls. Proofreadings of the catalogue for Tamoul 1-204 (old shelfmark). Printed by the atelier oriental de l’Imprimerie nationale. BnF “4-IMPROR-77 (B)”. — See p. 33, no. 122. — The same proofreadings with black ink handwritten corrections are found in Vinson et al. (1866-, f1-f49).
